org.mundo.util.plugins
Interface IPluginMonitor.IPluginHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
ServiceManager
Enclosing interface:
IPluginMonitor
public static interface IPluginMonitor.IPluginHandler

This interface defines the events raised by a plugin monitor. It gets called for each element under the root element that has this prefix and is responsible to perform whatever actions that are defined by the plugin.

Author:
AHa

Method Detail

pluginRegistered

void pluginRegistered(java.lang.String namespaceuri,
                      org.w3c.dom.Node configuration,
                      java.util.jar.JarFile sourcefile,
                      java.lang.ClassLoader jarclassloader)
                      throws SyntaxErrorException
Called whenever a new plugin is registered for the specific IPluginHandler. It may throw a SyntaxErrorException if the configuration is missing required parts. The method has transaction semantics: In case an exception gets thrown, the system's state after calling pluginRegistered MUST remain the same as before calling it.

Parameters:
namespaceuri - the XML namespace of the current configuration node
configuration - the XML configuration to parse
sourcefile - the JarFile which contained the plugin defintion
jarclassloader - a classloader already initialized to load classes out of the package's jar file
Throws:
SyntaxErrorException - if the XML document has errors in it

pluginUnRegistered

void pluginUnRegistered(java.lang.String namespaceuri,
                        org.w3c.dom.Node configuration)
Called whenever a plugin is unregistered for a specific IPluginHandler. As unregistration is done via deleting files, there is no way to prevent this. A plugin may be unregistered even if it's registration did not succeed.

Parameters:
namespaceuri - the XML namespace of the current configuration node
configuration - the XML configuration for the plugin

getNamespaceURI

java.lang.String getNamespaceURI()
The XML namespace which this plugin handler is responsible for.

Returns:
A String indicating the namespace
